title: 110_s454
content: The Act titled "Improving Access to Higher Education Act of 2007" increases Federal Pell Grants. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants, with changes including adjusting the grant amount to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008, with additional funds authorized and appropriated for implementation. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008, with additional funds of $4,331,000,000 appropriated for this purpose. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to increase Federal Pell Grants to $5,100 for the academic year 2007-2008, with an additional $4,331,000,000 appropriated for this purpose. The funds will be used to raise the maximum Pell Grant amount by $1,050 for award year 2007-2008, effective July 1, 2007. Expansion of deduction for interest on education loans. Increased Limitation on deduction for interest on education loans to $3,750 with an increase in phaseout limits to $75,000 ($150,000). Conforming amendment made to section 221(f)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The deduction for interest on education loans is limited to $3,750, with phaseout limits increased to $75,000 ($150,000). Section 221(f)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended accordingly. The deduction for interest on education loans is increased annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2006, and repeal the sunset provision of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 related to student loan interest deduction. SEC. 4. COVERDELL EDUCATION SAVINGS ACCOUNTS. Increase in allowable contributions for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts from $2,000 to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is specified. The allowable contribution for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts is increased to $3,000. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006. The sunset provision of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 does not apply to modifications to education individual retirement accounts. SEC. 5. REPEAL OF EGTRRA SUNSET FOR EMPLOYER-PROVIDED EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 shall not apply to section 411, extending the exclusion for employer-provided educational assistance.
